p: As for the inverse association, PD patients less frequently suffer from T2DM owing to the decrease in sympathetic activity caused by PD [ 59] and the use of L-dopa, a drug that increases glycogenolysis and inhibits the use of peripheral glucose [ 58, 59, 127]. Only one study showed a higher chance for the development of T2DM in PD patients [ 60]. A possible explanation for this is the abnormal tolerance to glucose in approximately half of the patients with PD [ 128] that could evolve to T2DM.
